meanings.definition: A group of single-celled microorganisms that lack a cell nucleus and are considered to be ancient forms of life.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study archaebacteria to learn about ancient life forms.
meanings.sent2: Archaebacteria can survive in extreme environments like hot springs.
meanings.sent3: The archaebacteria threw a party in the ancient petri dish.
meanings.sent4: In the world of microorganisms, archaebacteria stand as ancient warriors.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, archaebacteria look like tiny time travelers.

meanings.definition: The domain of organisms that includes archaebacteria.
meanings.sent1: The domain of archaebacteria is fascinating to biologists.
meanings.sent2: Scientists classify organisms into domains, with archaebacteria being one of them.
meanings.sent3: At the biology conference, the domain of archaebacteria won the award for uniqueness.
meanings.sent4: In the tree of life, archaebacteria branch out into their own domain.
meanings.sent5: The domain of archaebacteria is like a separate kingdom in the world of organisms.
